reviewText:
I tried, I really did. I WANTED to like this game.

I don't.

The game looks like a shoddy 2000 made game.

Graphic quality looks like crap, the UI is terribly made, animations are really crap. The playerbase is entirely Russian, and the game itself is just another point and click MMO. Melee enemies can hit you from any distance, and it doesn't do a good job of telling you the strength of your foes.

Classes are gender and race locked. You don't get to choose either. The class I tried, the Gunner, is locked at male, and locked at looking like an obese dwarf. Every class has the same limits.

Don't play this game. There are much better alternatives.

EDIT: Why did I only play for 0.3 hours? Because I couldn't TAKE any more of it. When I said that I wanted to like the game, let me explain. When Karos initially released, it was only in Russian. Once I saw Karos Returns was localized, I was going to give it the chance to redeem itself.

To address Lioside's comments:
1: There WERE NO SETTINGS to change. I am running a rather high-end graphics card that can run most games smoothly, so it wasn't a matter of pc specs.
2: An entirely Russian playerbase means very few players will understand English. No English comprehension means anyone who's new to the game, and speaks English, cannot recieve any help from the (Russian) community. It's like when a Spanish speaking person joins the NA server, then gets shouted out for saying a single phrase in Spanish.
3: It's 2015. Most games out there are NOT gender and race locked. TERA, RIFT, Guild Wars 2, Defiance, even things like Maplestory! The only games that ARE are outdated games like Karos Returns that have not ADAPTED and EVOLVED to suit the times. (Okay, fine, EDIT: Apparently TERA has 1 or two locked things. BUT MOST STILL AREN'T!)

So please, Lioside, don't make me commit another Liocide. I don't like killing arguments, especially not when they are so poorly reasoned.

Oh, and one last thing. 8 out of the 10 positive reviews are/were joke reviews people give to screw with the public. 2 were reasoned out, but both said the game was either dated, or focused towards the niche fanbase of the genre.

reviewText:
Didn't play much but here's what I can say:

- Graphics belong to the previous century (environment, character design, animation, hell even the text is hard to read)
- Alot of messed up textures: hair going through costumes, missing neck sometimes, not even talking about weapons...
- Movement is ok"
date:
yet totally outdated mechanics (about 20 years late)
- Music is fine
- Classes are gender AND race locked
- Homepage was down the first and last time I've checked
- Sound effects are very (too much) simple and not enough affected by distance
- Have to figure out many things by ourselves
- Game is not heavy (1.2gb to download)
- My keyboard is azerty type and I didn't have to rebind my keys to move correctly (yes that's rare
recommended:
very rare)

This game came out the 24th of July 2015 (the 30th on Steam). It might have a huge content and deep story but with all these things I've noted... it's not worth more than 2/10 (and that only if the content and story are good).



TL;DR:

NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE NOPE"

reviewText:
March 17 . . . . the game is back up! The authentication servers are back on line. Thumbs up.

March 12 . . . . .well the game is back down.  The authentication server is N.A. If you log in from Steam, you will get a blank screen with an animated background.  Thumbs down.

Feb 23 . . . .today, this game is back up.  Inventory, auction, quests, and monsters are back.  Both Steam and GamesCampus accounts can log in and interact with the environment. Gameplay is smoothe.  Look for updates in the comments section.  If I change it from Thumbs Down to Thumbs Up, its because I feel WebZen is being serious about Karos.

my original review, which was a thumbs down
I really really really like this game.  Unfortunately, GC was bought by WebZen in November 2015.  They offered a 175% coin credit just before Thanksgiving and then fired all the staff 2 weeks later.

Apparently, WebZen took the money and ran. Karos stopped functioning in January and its been a month, more or less, since WebZen disconnected the SQL servers (inventory/auction/quest/anything specific to the characters not in thier inventory AND the mob spawn) from the environment server. So you can't get any quests, access for inventory, really do anything.

I have not been able to log in from Steam for a month and my GC accounts are spotty, averaging once every week now.

Well, its the death of a game, as far as I am concerned.

I did have a 10 minute discussion with the California Attorney General's office and they asked me to write this up and send it in, so they could investigate and compel a refund of my $100 in game store credits.

If you want to see more, check out the gamescampus.com Karos Returns forums, or do a web search for reviews WebZen.

IF YOU SPEAK SPANISH, PORTEGUESE, RUSSIAN OR TURKISH, THOSE SERVERS ARE STILL WORKING. WebZen does not have the rights to those languages, only English.

reviewText: I appreciate the efforts of the Devs but truth betold these graphics are = to that of Perfect World, Which was released Several years ago around 2001 maybe.... 14 years later my graphics card can't even make this look pleasant. I did only play for a short time. In fact I usually follow a strict policy for MMO's of playing to at least 10 when most of the PVP unlocks however like other reviews. The Graphics, UI, and Tab Targeting is not very fluent. For the first 10 minutes I felt like my character was moving on its own... they pre add the loot, and the tab targeting as an ability to your action bar yet they have quick keys set up.... COUNTER PRODUCTIVE. Additionally if you have an auto clicker you could literally stay in the beginning area and kill stuff and just not loot. Honestly I think thats what the 15 people there were doing because no one was picking up anything. So bots are a given and when it will come to PVP content this will create frustrations and losses for the people actually playing. This game still has a long way to go also they should of used a newer engine.

reviewText: I used to play this when it was first launched in early 2000s. Since then it's been passed around to quite a few publishers in an attempt to regain some of its former glory, and revenues. Unfortunately, it just doesn't hold up against games out today. Still, it's very nostalgic rolling a new character and seeing what's changed since then. It's almost exactly as I remember it. The only differences that I can see are a handfull of gimmicks to skew their active player numbers, and cheap monetization tricks designed to bring in a quick buck, or more accurately; milk a dieing cow. All in all, it's a click to move, repetitive quest, grindy mmo. Though still fun to play through for a returning player from the old beta days.

reviewText:
A game very similar to Shaya, Rohan, Archlord and to a lesser extent Lineage 2.
Karos originally came out several years ago, this is just a release on Steam.
The graphics are on par with the above mentioned games so they look dated by today's standards but they are not bad.
You have a choice of seven classes and each one comes with a preset race and gender that you can not change, which is a big minus.
The game itself is not bad for its category, and for people that want something similar to Shaya and Rohan on Steam, this is better than most other attempts.
Of course its dated, but that does not necessarily mean bad.
Recommended only for fans of old style korean mmos.

reviewText:
Absolutely phenomenal. The graphics are next-gen. I really just can't put into words how amazing this game really is. I can't really tell you much about the game - not that I haven't played it a lot. I have played multiple hours before it came to Steam.

I hate to say it, but I had to uninstall due to my mother dying while I was playing it. I was spending too much time killing spiderlings in the wild. She told me her chest was hurting and I just ignored her pleas. I was so invested in killing that last spiderling that I just didn't get off the computer to help her.

Please, listen to me. You shouldn't play this game, it's too good for mankind.

reviewText:
I tried, I really did. I WANTED to like this game.

I don't.

The game looks like a shoddy 2000 made game.

Graphic quality looks like crap, the UI is terribly made, animations are really crap. The playerbase is entirely Russian, and the game itself is just another point and click MMO. Melee enemies can hit you from any distance, and it doesn't do a good job of telling you the strength of your foes.

Classes are gender and race locked. You don't get to choose either. The class I tried, the Gunner, is locked at male, and locked at looking like an obese dwarf. Every class has the same limits.

Don't play this game. There are much better alternatives.

EDIT: Why did I only play for 0.3 hours? Because I couldn't TAKE any more of it. When I said that I wanted to like the game, let me explain. When Karos initially released, it was only in Russian. Once I saw Karos Returns was localized, I was going to give it the chance to redeem itself.

To address Lioside's comments:
1: There WERE NO SETTINGS to change. I am running a rather high-end graphics card that can run most games smoothly, so it wasn't a matter of pc specs.
2: An entirely Russian playerbase means very few players will understand English. No English comprehension means anyone who's new to the game, and speaks English, cannot recieve any help from the (Russian) community. It's like when a Spanish speaking person joins the NA server, then gets shouted out for saying a single phrase in Spanish.
3: It's 2015. Most games out there are NOT gender and race locked. TERA, RIFT, Guild Wars 2, Defiance, even things like Maplestory! The only games that ARE are outdated games like Karos Returns that have not ADAPTED and EVOLVED to suit the times. (Okay, fine, EDIT: Apparently TERA has 1 or two locked things. BUT MOST STILL AREN'T!)

So please, Lioside, don't make me commit another Liocide. I don't like killing arguments, especially not when they are so poorly reasoned.

Oh, and one last thing. 8 out of the 10 positive reviews are/were joke reviews people give to screw with the public. 2 were reasoned out, but both said the game was either dated, or focused towards the niche fanbase of the genre.

date:

recommended:
very rare)

This game came out the 24th of July 2015 (the 30th on Steam). It might have a huge content and deep story but with all these things I've noted... it's not worth more than 2/10 (and that only if the content and story are good).

reviewText:
March 17 . . . . the game is back up! The authentication servers are back on line. Thumbs up.

March 12 . . . . .well the game is back down.  The authentication server is N.A. If you log in from Steam, you will get a blank screen with an animated background.  Thumbs down.

Feb 23 . . . .today, this game is back up.  Inventory, auction, quests, and monsters are back.  Both Steam and GamesCampus accounts can log in and interact with the environment. Gameplay is smoothe.  Look for updates in the comments section.  If I change it from Thumbs Down to Thumbs Up, its because I feel WebZen is being serious about Karos.

my original review, which was a thumbs down
I really really really like this game.  Unfortunately, GC was bought by WebZen in November 2015.  They offered a 175% coin credit just before Thanksgiving and then fired all the staff 2 weeks later.

Apparently, WebZen took the money and ran. Karos stopped functioning in January and its been a month, more or less, since WebZen disconnected the SQL servers (inventory/auction/quest/anything specific to the characters not in thier inventory AND the mob spawn) from the environment server. So you can't get any quests, access for inventory, really do anything.

I have not been able to log in from Steam for a month and my GC accounts are spotty, averaging once every week now.

Well, its the death of a game, as far as I am concerned.

I did have a 10 minute discussion with the California Attorney General's office and they asked me to write this up and send it in, so they could investigate and compel a refund of my $100 in game store credits.

If you want to see more, check out the gamescampus.com Karos Returns forums, or do a web search for reviews WebZen.

IF YOU SPEAK SPANISH, PORTEGUESE, RUSSIAN OR TURKISH, THOSE SERVERS ARE STILL WORKING. WebZen does not have the rights to those languages, only English.

This game still has a long way to go also they should of used a newer engine.

reviewText: I used to play this when it was first launched in early 2000s. Since then it's been passed around to quite a few publishers in an attempt to regain some of its former glory, and revenues. Unfortunately, it just doesn't hold up against games out today. Still, it's very nostalgic rolling a new character and seeing what's changed since then. It's almost exactly as I remember it. The only differences that I can see are a handfull of gimmicks to skew their active player numbers, and cheap monetization tricks designed to bring in a quick buck, or more accurately; milk a dieing cow. All in all, it's a click to move, repetitive quest, grindy mmo. Though still fun to play through for a returning player from the old beta days.

reviewText:
A game very similar to Shaya, Rohan, Archlord and to a lesser extent Lineage 2.
Karos originally came out several years ago, this is just a release on Steam.
The graphics are on par with the above mentioned games so they look dated by today's standards but they are not bad.
You have a choice of seven classes and each one comes with a preset race and gender that you can not change, which is a big minus.
The game itself is not bad for its category, and for people that want something similar to Shaya and Rohan on Steam, this is better than most other attempts.
Of course its dated, but that does not necessarily mean bad.
Recommended only for fans of old style korean mmos.
